treatment.reference: Methanolobus zinderi sp. nov., a methylotrophic methanogen isolated from a deep subsurface coal seam IJSEM 59:1064-1069
treatment.description: Cells are irregular coccoids, 1.0–2.0 µm in diameter. Cells are lysed by detergents. Gram-negative. Non-motile. Cells grow by forming methane from methanol, monomethylamine, dimethylamine, or trimethylamine. Cells are unable to grow with H2/CO2, acetate, formate, or dimethylsulfide. The maximum rate of growth is between 40–50 ˚C, 0.2–0.6 M NaCl, 100–200 mM MgCl2 and pH 7.0–8.0. No organic compounds are required for growth. The type strain, SD1T (=ATCC BAA-1601T=DSM 21339T), was isolated from a coal seam near Monroe, LA, USA. The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 42±1 mol%.
